result.execSummary:
The defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.
with credit for 306 days time served.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kenneth Wayne Whitaker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Certification of transcript of proceedings of GUILTY PLEA/ SENTENCING HEARING commencing 1/12/16 received and filed. (30 Pages.)

Statements made as to sentencing.  
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 5 YEARS CONSECUTIVE TO ANY OTHER SENTENCE, with credit for 306 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 2 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 3 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is not eligible for the "Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program".

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges.
As to all costs and surcharges, Court orders DOC shall collect up to 25% of prison funds.  Remaining balance to be paid during the period of extended supervision.  Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment. 

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor. Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. 

Filed,
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in court with attorney Nathan Francis Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1. Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders COUNTS 2 and 3 DISMISSED and read-in.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Plea questionnaire received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms or body armor.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court hears defense argument. Court places findings on the record.  Court DENIES defense motion to supress.  Defense requests resolution date. **Case retained in Br. 35 per Judge Rosa.**  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Continuation of motion hearing from 10/2/15 proceeds. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer Thomas Ozelie, MPD Officer Allen Tenhaken.  Sworn for defense: defendant. Court hears argument from the State. Due to the lateness of the hour, Court to hear argument from defense on next date.  Decision scheduled for November 3, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Hearing re: defense motion to supress proceeds, Court issues witness exclusion order. Sworn for the State: MPD Officer James Hunter, MPD Officer Thomas Ozelie. Due to lateness of the hour, Court orders motion hearing adjourned.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker not in court, in custody.  Jay Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for supression motion hearing today. Court is in trial and unable to conduct hearing today. Motion hearing scheduled for October 2, 2015 at 8:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker not in court, in custody.  Jay Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Matter is scheduled for stop motion hearing today. Court is in trial.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court. Case remains scheduled for motion hearing on 8/10/15 at 1:30.  All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse. Case adjourned to Branch 07.
FILED, MOTION FOR MODIFICATION OF BOND

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 7.   Court ordered case adjourned for bail/bond hearing in Branch 7.   All parties notified as of August 03, 2015 this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35, in room 629 of the courthouse.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for 07-16-2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs in court, defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker not in court, in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court ordered case adjourned for motion hearing in Branch 7.  Motion hearing scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in custody.  Jay Randal Pucek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Thomas McAdams, Branch 07.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference to Branch 07.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.   
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in court with attorney Jamie Francis Cimpl-Wiemer.  
Defendant Kenneth Wayne Whitaker in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge McAdams, Branch 7.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to all Misdemeanor Counts.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  
Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
